column2: died aged 102) was the husband of Lobelia Sackville-Baggins and the founder of the short-lived Sackville-Baggins Family. He was representative of the greedy and ill-mannered traits of his family.

column1: Otho was the only child of Longo Baggins and Camellia Sackville. Through his mother
column2: he was the head of the Sackville Family
column3: so he adopted the double surname out of custom. He married Lobelia Sackville-Baggins with whom he had a son named Lotho Sackville-Baggins.

column1: He was also second in line to patriarchy of the Baggins Family
column2: and would have been Bilbo Baggins heir were it not for his adoption of his cousin Frodo Baggins. This did not sit well with Otho and his wife
column3: as they both dearly wanted to live in Bag End.

column2: Otho was a guest at Bilbos Farewell Party. After Bilbo had vanished in front of the crowd during the celebration
column3: Otho and his wife departed in wrath. He did not live long enough to see Bag End as he died in ; it was six years later when Lobelia eventually did come into possession of Bag End
column4: and moved in with her son.

column1: The name Otho was meaningless in contemporary Hobbitish Westron. It represented an original name Otha.

1981: The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series):
:Although he is not named as such until the programme credits
column2: John Livesey plays Otho at Bilbos 111th Birthday party.  He and Lobelia are given a brief exchange complaining about being part of one gross
column3: and questioning what Frodo coming into his inheritance means.

column2: though he does not have any lines.

column3: appears briefly in both the The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey (extended edition) of The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey where he and Lobelia Sackville-Baggins are seen in the Hobbiton marketplace
column4: as well as The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies where he and Lobelia again appear at the end when Bilbo Bagginss possessions are being auctioned off. He once again does not have any lines in these films.
